<title
    level="1"
    right="Feat 2"
    pfs="Limited"
>
[Oatia Skysage Dedication](/Feats.aspx?ID=4064) <actions string="" />
</title>

<spoilers>May contain spoilers from Gatewalkers</spoilers>

<traits>
<trait label="Uncommon" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=159" />
<trait label="Archetype" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=12" />
<trait label="Dedication" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=41" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Pathfinder #187: The Seventh Arch](/Sources.aspx?ID=192) pg. 82</row>

**Archetype** [Oatia Skysage](/Archetypes.aspx?ID=199)

**Prerequisites**
Trained in [Occultism](/Skills.aspx?ID=11)

</column>

---

Your study of the stars unlocks supernatural insights and magic. You either become trained in [Astronomy Lore](/Skills.aspx?ID=8) or an expert in Occultism.

 You learn to cast spontaneous spells and gain the Cast a Spell activity. You gain a spell repertoire with two common cantrips of your choice; these cantrips can be from any spell tradition, but they must be [divination](/Traits.aspx?ID=47) spells. You cast these spells as occult spells as you draw on the stars and night sky. You're trained in occult spell attack rolls and spell DCs. If you have a hand free and you've gazed at the night sky in the last 24 hours, you can usually replace material components with somatic components, so you don't need to use a spell component pouch. Your key spellcasting ability for these spells is Intelligence.

**Special** You can't select another dedication feat until you have gained two other feats from the Oatia skysage archetype.

<title level="2">Oatia Skysage Dedication leads to...</title>
[Basic Skysage Divination](/Feats.aspx?ID=4065), [Minor Omen](/Feats.aspx?ID=4068), [Night's Glow](/Feats.aspx?ID=4067), [Night's Shine](/Feats.aspx?ID=4072), [Night's Warning](/Feats.aspx?ID=4073), [Scholar's Hunch](/Feats.aspx?ID=4069), [Stargazer's Eyes](/Feats.aspx?ID=4066), [Starlight Armor](/Feats.aspx?ID=4074), [Starlit Spells](/Feats.aspx?ID=4070)
